intro: Eschscholzia brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegge poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces capsules that contain numerous small, dark seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
